issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Useless IAM DEBUG messages displayed on federated setups

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Region federation performs lookups between regions for global identifiers. Global identifiers such as account aliases cannot be identified as belonging to a particular region.

It is expected that the account information is not present on most regions, so we should not log errors when information is not found:

{code}
Mon Jun 20 11:04:49 2016 ERROR [IdentityService:Identity.42] [com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.identity.IdentityService.handleException(IdentityService.java):413] com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user
com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:492)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Accounts.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(Accounts.java:140)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabasePrincipalProvider.lookupPrincipalByCanonicalId(DatabasePrincipalProvider.java:142)

Caused by: com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:488)
	... 64 more

fields.summary: IAM spurious errors logged for federated regions

comments.body:
[~sjones], just to confirm, this error will still show up, but not as an 'ERROR', but as a 'DEBUG' message?  This is what I am seeing in the cloud-debug.log on the UFS:
{code}
..
Wed Nov 16 14:51:59 2016 DEBUG [DatabaseAuthProvider:Euare.08] com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user
..
Wed Nov 16 14:51:59 2016 DEBUG [DatabaseAuthProvider:Euare.08] Error occurred looking for account by canonical ID 4d2c625e94f61424556522c161714e216050112e115d2f21404350384b2e4062 with exception com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:488) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Accounts.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(Accounts.java:140) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.entities.AccountEntity.genCanonicalId(AccountEntity.java:158) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.entities.AccountEntity.populateCanonicalId(AccountEntity.java:135) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.entities.AccountEntity.generateOnCommit(AccountEntity.java:130) | com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities.persist(Entities.java:870) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.doAddAccount(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:213) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.addAccount(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:174) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Accounts.addAccount(Accounts.java:184) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Privileged.createAccount(Privileged.java:125) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareService.createAccount(EuareService.java:133) |
....
{code}

[~hspencer], that is expected. The fix removes the error logging from the identity service but there is still debug logging from elsewhere which will not be seen in a default configuration. I'm not sure the debug logging is useful, so may open a separate bug to remove that also.
[~sjones], okay.  Thanks for confirming.  Regarding the output in the debug logging - would this information be helpful during any triaging of a federated setup?
[~hspencer], it does not seem useful as it is expected that lookups will occur for unknown users for some identifier types (such as canonical id)

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.3.1-0.25151.74.20161111git2c03a72.el7}}

*Steps*

# Set up two Eucalyptus 4.3.1 cloud using VPC
#* hspencer-207
#* hspencer-208
# Followed the [steps for scripted setup for Federation in Confluence|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/QA/4.2+Federation#id-4.2Federation-Script-Assisted]
{code}
[root@d-14 ~]# euca-describe-regions
REGION	drake	http://ec2.h-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	future	http://ec2.g-08-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/

[root@c-26 ~]# euca-describe-regions
REGION	drake	http://ec2.h-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	future	http://ec2.g-08-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
{code}
# Created non-eucalyptus account
{code}
[root@d-14 ~]# euare-accountcreate -a quality-assurance -w > .euca/qa-admin.ini
[root@d-14 ~]# euca-describe-availability-zones --region qa-admin@drake
AVAILABILITYZONE	views	available
[root@d-14 ~]# euca-describe-availability-zones --region qa-admin@future
AVAILABILITYZONE	ds2	available
AVAILABILITYZONE	evo	available
{code}
# Checked cloud-debug.log on UFS from each 'region'.  Confirmed messages showed under 'DEBUG' and not 'ERROR':
{code}
[root@h-02 ~]# grep -i "No such user" /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log* | head -10
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.3:Wed Nov 16 20:56:34 2016 DEBUG [DatabaseAuthProvider:Identity.26] com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.3:Wed Nov 16 20:56:34 2016 DEBUG [DatabaseAuthProvider:Identity.26] Error occurred looking for account by canonical ID 374e4e434f50405f4a301c6042144121544524426056b1241cb373644b181f2e with exception com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:488) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Accounts.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(Accounts.java:140) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabasePrincipalProvider.lookupPrincipalByCanonicalId(DatabasePrincipalProvider.java:142) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.identity.IdentityService.describePrincipal(IdentityService.java:144) |

/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.3:Wed Nov 16 20:56:35 2016 DEBUG [DatabaseAuthProvider:Identity.26] Error occurred looking for account by canonical ID 374e4e434f50405f4a301c6042144121544524426056b1241cb373644b181f2e with exception com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:488) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Accounts.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(Accounts.java:140) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabasePrincipalProvider.lookupPrincipalByCanonicalId(DatabasePrincipalProvider.java:142) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.identity.IdentityService.describePrincipal(IdentityService.java:144) |

[root@g-08-01 ~]# grep -i "No such user" /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log* | head -10
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.10:Tue Nov 15 18:45:23 2016 DEBUG [DatabaseAuthProvider:Identity.06] com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.10:Tue Nov 15 18:45:23 2016 DEBUG [DatabaseAuthProvider:Identity.06] Error occurred looking for account by canonical ID 44561d1581f513c421a2838214a0e12e39283d41273e3523341a25c5c4f544e0 with exception com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:488) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Accounts.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(Accounts.java:140) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabasePrincipalProvider.lookupAccountIdentifiersByCanonicalId(DatabasePrincipalProvider.java:198) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.identity.IdentityService.describeAccounts(IdentityService.java:226) |

[~sjones], raised EUCA-12952 per our conversation regarding the  DEBUG message.
